title: Are all ballpoint pen inks waterproof? - Quora

response.answer_text: At least since László Bíró invented the ballpoint in the 1930s, a “ballpoint pen” has referred to a device that uses a viscous, quick-drying, waterproof ink fed onto paper by a rough rolling ball. In my experience, if it has a water-soluble ink then the device is a “rollerball” pen. It features a smoother, easier writing experience but the ink isn’t waterproof, no matter how long it’s been dry. In my opinion, the supreme writing experience with water soluble ink is with a fountain pen. Rollerball disposable pens and refills expend quickly — usually just when you need them. Then you have to throw them away. The short lifespan makes them contribute more than their share to the world’s landfill and discarded plastic problem.
